message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with temporal action detection in videos, which involves analyzing and recognizing patterns in visual data. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the proposed method involves the use of a siamese network based on 3D ConvNets, which is a deep learning technique commonly used in computer vision tasks. This further supports the likelihood of the paper belonging to the cs.CV sub-category. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques to classify and detect action instances in videos, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. 

The proposed method involves reducing intra-action variations and enlarging inter-action differences, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category, as this sub-category deals with the analysis and processing of multimedia data. 

The paper involves the use of deep learning techniques to analyze and recognize patterns in visual data, which suggests that it may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper involves the use of similarity scores to compare input pairs of video proposal segments, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category, as this sub-category deals with the analysis and retrieval of information from large datasets.
